title: Machine Learning Overview
content:
## 1. Machine Learning definition ## Arthur Samuel (1959). Machine Learning: Field of study that gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed. Tom Mitchell (1998) Well-posed Learning Problem: A computer program is said to learn from experience E with respect to some task T and some performance measure P, if its performance on T, as measured by P, improves with experience E. | Model | | Method | | :------:| :------: | :------: | | Supervised Learning | Classification
Regression | - | | Unsupervised Learning | Clustering | - | ## Reference ## [1] [Machine Learning Course of Andrew-Ng](https://study.163.com/course/courseLearn.htm?courseId=1004570029#/learn/video?lessonId=1049052745&courseId=1004570029) [2] [Hinton机器学习与神经网络](https://study.163.com/course/courseMain.htm?courseId=1003842018&_trace_c_p_k2_=86d239c5492c41dbb0d290e57db3a39e)

title: Probability Theory
content:
设$A$,$B$为两个事件，且P(A)>0,称
$$ \sum_{i=0}^n i^2 = \frac{(n^2+n)(2n+1)}{6} $$
为事件
